t: To the Chief Musician. Set to “The Silent Dove in Distant Lands.” A Michtam of David when the Philistines captured him in Gath.
Be*pn merciful to me, O God, for man would swallow me up; Fighting*ld all day he oppresses me.
My*ld enemies would hound me*i all day, For*ld there*i are*i many who fight against me, O Most High.
Whenever*ln I am afraid, I*ld will trust in You.
In*ld God (I will praise His word), In*ld God I have put my trust; I*ld will not fear. What*ld can flesh do to me?
All*ln day they twist my words; All*ld their thoughts are*i against me for evil.
They*ld gather together, They*ld hide, they mark my steps, When*ld they lie in wait for my life.
Shall*ld they escape by iniquity? In*ld anger cast down the peoples, O God!
You*ln number my wanderings; Put*ld my tears into Your bottle; Are*ild they*i not in Your book?
When*ld I cry out to*i You,*i Then*ld my enemies will turn back; This*ld I know, because God is*i for me.
In*ld God (I will praise His*i word), In*ld the Lord*s (I will praise His*i word),
In*ld God I have put my trust; I*ld will not be afraid. What*ld can man do to me?
Vows*ln made*i to You are*i binding*i upon me, O God; I*ld will render praises to You,
For*ld You have delivered my soul from death. Have*ild You*i not kept*i my feet from falling, That*ld I may walk before God In*ld the light of the living?
